crazyballrun.game.physics.bodies

Class PhysicalBody

  • java.lang.Object
    • crazyballrun.game.physics.bodies.PhysicalBody
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SoftBody, Vehicle

    public abstract class PhysicalBody
extends java.lang.Object
    The PhysicalBody offers an interface for physical objects in the world. This implies physical interactions between several rigid bodies through collision and applying external and internal forces and torques to move or rotate the object.

      • setPhysicalProperty

        public void setPhysicalProperty(java.lang.String property,
                       double value)
        Sets a physical property due to its name. If property equals P_CENTER_OFFSET_X or P_CENTER_OFFSET_Y the measurement is "pixels"! In any other case it is textures.
        Parameters:
        property - name of the physical property
        value - value for the property

      • isRigidBody

        public abstract boolean isRigidBody()
        Defines if the rigid body is really "rigid" or rather soft. If this method returns false, that means, that collisions between another rigid body and this body will not be checked. HOWEVER, collision between this body and other rigid bodies will be checked. One example for using this function with 'return false' is following: assuming the rigid body is a bonus package, we do not need to check both collisions - vehicle -> bonus package and bonus package -> vehicle. If the vehicle hits the bonus package, there shouldn't be any physical effect applied to the vehicle (but the bonus-effect). To avoid physical influence of the bonus package to the vehicle we just check for collisions bonus-package -> vehicle instead and then apply the bonus-effect through the "onCollision(obj)"-method provided by the bonus-package implementation. WHY can we do that? We may do that because if the vehicle crashes into a bonus-package, a collision from bonus-package to vehicle exists for sure, too.
        Returns:
        'false' if collision checks between other rigid bodies and this object should be avoided. However a collision the other way around (this rigid body -> other rigid bodies) will be still checked. If 'true', collisions in both directions are checked.

      • getBoundingSphere

        public abstract double getBoundingSphere()
        Calculates and returns the radius of the bodies' bounding sphere for efficient collision detection.
        Returns:
        radius of the bounding sphere

      • isColliding

        public abstract boolean isColliding(double px,
                  double py)
        Finds out if the point is inside of the rigid body. This method may be used by other RigidBodies to find out if there's a collision.
        Parameters:
        px - 2D collision point
        py - 2D collision point
        Returns:
        'true' if the given point is colliding with the rigid body.

      • isColliding

        public abstract boolean isColliding(PhysicalBody obj)
        Finds out if there's a collision with another rigid body. This method usually calls the "isCollision(Vector2D)"-method of the other PhysicalBody with all possible collision points this rigid body has. Another possible implementation might just calculate the distance to the other PhysicalBody to check for collisions.
        Parameters:
        obj - reference to another rigid body
        Returns:
        "true" if colliding

      • isColliding

        public abstract Vector2D isColliding(Level map)
        Checks for a collision with a texture. This may occure due to a wall inside a texture. The function compare the ground of every collision points with to the GroundProperty.WALL and GroundProperty.WATER if the object cannot swim. If a hit has been found the function should return true. For checking the correct texture the method should use "Level.getGroundProperty(position)", where position is the position of all the collision points of the rigid body.
        Parameters:
        map - reference to the level
        Returns:
        collision point

      • updateData

        public abstract void updateData()
        Updates the collision data of the rigid body due to the new position and orientation.

      • setProperty

        public abstract void setProperty(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String value)
        Sets one property. This method is used by the LevelObjectParser to support implementation specific data (e.g. vehicles have a completely different set of properties than not-moving obstacles).
        Parameters:
        name - name of the property
        value - value for the property

      • initialize

        public abstract void initialize()
        Initializes the rigid body. This method is called after finishing parsing the object (that means all properties have been set).
